section.title: dispStart not used in JLIFF
section.para: Display text - holds an alternative user-friendly display representation of the original data of the start marker of an inline code.
section.programlisting: <unit id="1"> <originalData> <data id="d1">\cf1\ul\b\f1\fs24 </data> <data id="d2">\cf0\ulnone\b0\f0\fs22 </data> </originalData> <segment> <source>Example of <pc id="1" dataRefStart="d1" dataRefEnd="d2" dispStart="<span>" dispEnd="</span>"> formatted text</pc>.</source> </segment> </unit>
section.para: In the example above, the dispStart and dispEnd attributes provide a more user-friendly representation of the original formatting codes.

note.para: To provide a plain text equivalent of the code, use the equivStart attribute.
